org.momo.dict
Class DictionaryItem

java.lang.Object
  org.momo.dict.DictionaryItem

public class DictionaryItem
extends java.lang.Object

holds a single item. is exactly 8 byte wide..

Author:
moritzhaarmann

          perfoms a lookup. if partial is set to true returns even an incomplete match in favor of null.

 void setPrevSibling(DictionaryItem prevSibling)

Method Detail

create

public static DictionaryItem create(java.lang.String string)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
this is a lookup-or-create method. on successful lookup, the looked up item gets increased, otherwise this item is created. always returns a dictionary item.

Parameters:
string - the new item
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

lookup

public static DictionaryItem lookup(java.lang.String query,
                                    boolean partial)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
perfoms a lookup. if partial is set to true returns even an incomplete match in favor of null.

Parameters:
partial -
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

addSibling

public DictionaryItem addSibling(java.lang.String what)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
adds a sibling in the form of a string to this node. of course, it first performs a check whether that sibling already exists. if so, it delegates the same action to that sibling.

Parameters:
what - the string to add. please note that you are not supposed to deliver full strings, but only the range to add.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
java.lang.Exception

              throws java.lang.Exception
decreases the "amount" of a node by -1.

java.lang.Exception

getFirstChild

public DictionaryItem getFirstChild()
                             throws java.lang.Exception
Returns:
a child
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if there is no child. returns the first child, if any.

getNextSibling

public DictionaryItem getNextSibling()
                              throws java.io.IOException
getter for the next sibling

Returns:
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getParent

public DictionaryItem getParent()
returns a node's parent, as DictionaryItem. The item is not guaranteed to be not null, e.g. when calling a root node.

Returns:
a DictionaryItem representing the parent.

hasSibling

public boolean hasSibling()
indicates whether a node has more siblings.

Returns:
true, if there are siblings, false, if not.

increase

public void increase()
              throws java.lang.Exception
increases this nodes amount by +1.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

isLeaf

public boolean isLeaf()
checks if this node is a leaf, i.e. has no children.

Returns:
true if there are no children, false if there are.

isRoot

public boolean isRoot()
returns whether this item is in the root tree, i.e. has no parent node.

Returns:
true if this is a root node, false if it is not.

modifyTreeAmountWith

public void modifyTreeAmountWith(int change)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
helper to do the work for de- and increase. this method is called for every node in the path to the root once. Each call is quite expensive because a lot of saving occurs here.

Parameters:
change - the amount of change. +1 and -1 will be mostly used.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

setChar

public void setChar(char c)
sets the char of a node. should only be called before the first save.

Parameters:
c -

setFirstChild

public void setFirstChild(DictionaryItem firstChild)
sets the first child of a node, but only if this child is already saved, because otherwise strange memory effects occur. Drops all preceding first childs.

Parameters:
firstChild - the new first child.

setFirstChildPosition

public void setFirstChildPosition(int fromShort)
simple setter for the first child position.

Parameters:
fromShort - the position of the first child.

setNextSibling

public void setNextSibling(DictionaryItem newNextSibling)
setter for the next sibling. takes a dictionaryitem.

Parameters:
nextSibling - the next sibling, as dictionaryitem.

setNextSiblingPosition

public void setNextSiblingPosition(int newPos)
sets the raw position of the next sibling. checks for some boundaries.

Parameters:
fromShort - the raw position of the next sibling.

setParent

public void setParent(DictionaryItem parent)
setter for the parent node. important, because it also set's the full word.

Parameters:
parent - the parent node, as DictionaryItem

setPrevSibling

public void setPrevSibling(DictionaryItem prevSibling)
sets the previous sibling of an item. includes a call to setParent, which basically pulls up all stuff like assigning a full word.

Parameters:
prevSibling - the previous sibling

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
custom toString.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

           throws java.lang.Exception
wrapper for the Dictionary's writeItem method.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
